title: Chickpea, Coconut and Chard Curry
description: This curry has the unique combination of a guilty yet wholesome treat - it’s easy enough for a midweek meal, but surprisingly luxurious enough for a special night in. Served with rice it’s the perfect meal in itself. Or buy some peshwari naans from the shop (or your local Indian) as a treat - homemade curry and shop bought naans are one of life’s simple pleasures.

ingredients: 2 cloves of garlic, peeled and finely chopped
1 square inch piece of ginger, finely chopped
1 400ml can of full fat coconut milk

method: Heat the oil (or ghee) in a large saucepan over a medium heat, then place the chopped onion in it, and cook gently for 5 minutes, or until softened slightly.
Add the garlic, ginger, tomato puree and chilli and cook for another 2 minutes, stir frequently.
Sprinkle in the spices and cook these out for another 2 minutes, so it smells fragrant and delicious. Stir often.

Add the cherry tomatoes, chickpeas, coconut milk and salt into the pan. Increase the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Toss in the swiss chard and cook for about 2 more minutes until wilted, then serve.
Store in the fridge for up to three days.
